oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Odd Fellows Hall, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
Odd Fellows Hall (Nashville, Tenn.); Independent Order of Odd Fellows
